subject: Double VAT charge
description_text:
Hey! I believe I was charged VAT twice. From your store prices and the FAQ,
if the value is more than 150€ the VAT is payed on arrival to customs,
which I just payed for (just got charged around 110€ VAT by customs).
However, in your checkout, the final price doesn't take this into account.
If the order is more than 150€, I don't get the VAT discount, like I
usually do in other stores (AliExpress, for example). The price remains the
same, wether the final value is more or less than 150€, which doesn't make
sense to me.
I just tested and the price remains the same for the same item, if the
order goes over that 150€ threshold. So for a order that is 100€ you pay
23% VAT on my behalf through IOSS and I wouldn't pay anything to customs.
However, if I add another 100€ item, the total is now 200€ but now you are
not paying taxes through IOSS. So you ask for the same amount of money for
the same item, but now I would have to pay 46€ VAT on arrival, making the
order 246€.
This does not seem correct, if you are not paying any taxes on my behalf,
why am I being charged the full price?

conversations.body_text: Hi Rui Martins,    Please provide the UPS payment invoice, and we will reimburse you for a portion of it. No need to worry.
Hello! I annexed the UPS invoice, thanks!

Hi Rui Martins,     When orders exceed the €150 threshold, we do not collect VAT on your behalf. Therefore, the total order amount does not include tax. We appreciate your understanding. You will pay €113.99 in VAT, and we will reimburse you €40.
